pr_title: GEODE-8692: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException may be thrown in RegionAdvisor.processProfilesQueuedDuringInitialization

timeline.message: GEODE-8692: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException may be thrown in RegionAdvisor.processProfilesQueuedDuringInitialization

timeline.bodyText: Could this hardcoded 3 be replaced with serials.length to ensure that the test doesn't fail if someone modifies the size of serials?
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: Two of the variable names in this test, qbp and pbr could be a bit more descriptive. I don't think there's anything wrong with long variable names, providing it's providing extra clarity.
timeline.author: DonalEvans

timeline.bodyText: Might it be worth adding a check to verify that ProxyBucketRegion.removeIdWithSerial() is never called for the contents of regionAdvisor.buckets since the serial is always ILLEGAL_SERIAL? Or would that be outside the scope of this test?
timeline.author: DonalEvans

replies.bodyText: It definitely couldn't hurt to add it.  I feel like this test needs something more, but I'm not sure what.  The intent was mainly to show that processProfilesQueuedDuringInitialization() wouldn't result in an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when given the serials that would be returned if buckets were null when getBucketSerials() is called.  What do you think?
replies.author: sabbey37

replies.bodyText: I think that just showing there's no ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is probably a bit weak, since we're explicitly setting the contents of both arrays in the test, so we know that exception isn't possible here. Asserting that the method is behaving as expected for the given conditions (not calling removeIdWithSerial() for buckets that correspond to an ILLEGAL_SERIAL value) would make for a more meaningful test.
replies.author: DonalEvans
